name: Hồ Xuân Hương Morning Run
highlight: 6km paved loop at 1,480m — the lakeside mist at 6am is worth every early alarm. Fully runnable on road shoes, mostly flat. Cooldown bánh mì at the Trần Phú stalls right after.

name: Vườn Hoa — Flower Garden
highlight: Mimosa blooms (Feb–Mar) turn the gardens gold and purple — great warm-up walk before hitting the hill loops. Bring a camera: golden hour light here is exceptional.

name: Langbiang Mountain Trail
highlight: 860m vert in 8km — the toughest line in the CP12 trail guide. Pick up the GPX at reception. The plateau at 2,167m runs faster than it looks from below.

name: Chợ Đêm — Night Market
highlight: Post-run recovery done right: hồng (persimmon) wine for antioxidants, bánh tráng nướng for the carbs. Walk via the back lanes — skip the tourist main strip.

name: Phú Đổng Loop — Hill Reps
highlight: Our doorstep hill reps: 8× up Phú Đổng street gains 120m in 600m. Grab the hand-drawn map at reception — the shortcut through the strawberry farms adds a 2km single-track stretch.

name: Trúc Lâm Zen Monastery
highlight: Take the cable car up; earn the 4km pine-trail descent back to town. Fully runnable with switchbacks — time it early morning before tour groups hit the trail.
